listings.description:
Available May 15, 2015. 
High ceilings/top floor! $2650/month ($2,850 couple) including water and garbage. Wifi, cable, electricity, and enclosed parking additional. Nine month minimum. Prefer at least one year; long-term residency desired.

Rent my roomy, furnished sunny one-bedroom modern condo (about 80 sq. meters or 900 sq. ft. w/ covered balcony). On top floor (4th) of redecorated building with elevator. 15-foot-high ceiling in living/dining room; breakfast counter/bar; computer area (with modern workforce® computer desk, cabinet storage, counter space); wall-to-wall carpeting and parquet kitchen/hall floors; large closet; full-sized newer washer and dryer IN UNIT, large new stainless steel refrigerator, dishwasher; garbage disposal; microwave; bathroom with tub/shower. Wood-burning fireplace. Living room opens onto skylight-covered private balcony with view to the park for al fresco dining.

Apartment furnishings include queen-sized bed, dresser, kitchen utensils, dishes, pots and pans, linens. Queen futon couch, two comfy easy chairs and ottoman, TV, DVD & VCR players, desk, solid maple dining room table and chairs. Overstuffed upholstered chairs [shown] and futon [shown] and larger computer desk recently replaced the vintage bamboo and wicker furniture in some photos. Roof deck with 360° views, great for sun-worshippers or stargazing. This is in addition to your private view balcony with umbrella, table and chairs and lush plants. 

This desirable Adams Point condo is across from lovely Lake Merritt in Oakland, just off Grand Ave., walking distance to 19th St. BART station and Grand/Lakeshore shopping district including Arizmendi Bakery, coffeehouses (Peet's, Starbucks), beautiful Whole Foods (walking distance), Trader Joe's, Noah's bagels, fine restaurants and cafes; Rockridge and Piedmont Ave. shopping and recreation minutes away by car or bike. Sunday farmer's market at Jack London Square, or Saturday's in neighborhood -- and then there's always Chinatown restaurants and markets. Walking distance or short drive to the hip new Uptown District's trendy restaurants, bars and art galleries. You'll love my neighborhood!

Short commute to San Francisco, Emeryville, Berkeley (UC) or Mills College; 15 minute walk to downtown Oakland 19th St. BART. Rent includes garbage and water. One reserved parking space in secure garage in building available. Cable ready. ($2975 One person all-inclusive includes Wifi, cable, electricity allowance, local phone and parking.) Move-out cleaning fee of $75 and security deposit required.

Please E-mail with your DATES, PERSONAL INFORMATION and PHONE NUMBER for call back.
BUT -- VERY IMPORTANT: FIRST Please tell me a little about yourself as the most important thing is that you are responsible, dependable, and quiet, and will respect my condo and neighbors. Where do you work? Where do you live now and why do you want a sublet, etc.? I need to know about you and then talk to you before I will schedule an appointment or confirm. Thank you!

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

www.livehigby.com

Two-level Townhouse-style unit that has been extensively remodeled! Apartment is located just one block from the Cal campus and around the corner from the RSF gym!

Located on the top floor, apartment features a remodeled kitchen with granite counters, maple cabinets, and stainless steel appliances. A gas range, microwave, and large fridge/freezer come included with the unit. Each bedroom is roomy and has newly installed double pane windows. Second bedroom is more private and located on a second level like a townhome and comes with a huge closet for extra storage. Second bedroom also features large open skylights that let in lots of natural lighting. Bathroom comes with brand new fixtures and features decorative tiling. Hardwood floors come installed in the main living areas.

Located close to the SW corner of campus, the building is within easy walking distance to Shattuck/Telegraph Ave and the RSF gym. Numerous cafes, restaurants, and stores are also located close by on Shattuck or Telegraph. Building has bike parking and credit card operated laundry machines on-site. listings.description:
Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. 

We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. Most people qualify when they have a 580 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.

I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.

In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. 

The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. 

This is just 1 of the homes that are available in San Leandro, Hayward, San Lorenzo and Oakland. THERE IS AN E MAIL LIST AVAILABLE THAT GIVES YOU ALL THE DETAILS OF THE PROGRAM AND THE INSTRUCTIONS TO GET QUALIFIED AS WELL AS PICTURES AND DETAILS OF ALL THE HOUSES. PLEASE TEXT OR E MAIL THE REQUEST WITH YOUR E MAIL ADDRESS SO I CAN SEND THESE TO YOU.

This home in San Leandro is 4 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and 1750 square feet. It has a 1 car attached garage and this is all on a lot that is almost 4,000 square feet. 

There are 50 homes available from $2175-$3400 and the homes are 760-2200 square feet with 1-5 bedrooms. There are also Condominiums and Townhomes that have payments ranging from $1625-$2720 per month with 1-4 bedrooms and 680-1700 square feet. These properties will have a separate Home Owners Association due per month of $200-$430 per month. 

The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in.

To qualify you must have at least
1. A credit score of 580 or higher (credit karma is a place to check if you aren't sure of your credit score)
2. You will need to prove your income with the last 30 days paystubs and the last 2 years tax returns
3. No Bankruptcy in the last 2 years
4. No Short Sale, or Foreclosure in the last 3 years.

Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate Eric Wexelman

I can respond fastest to texts and e mails as I can't answer calls when I am with my other clients.

listings.title: Huge Onebedroom with all utilities paid.

listings.description:
in this 851 sq. ft. 1 bedroom condo at Watergate, Emeryville's premiere resort condominium community. It's a commuter's dream just 15 minutes from SF, 10 minutes from UC Berkeley.
Upgrades include  The large dining room will accommodate a good sized dining room set and the spacious bedroom has two large closets with mirror doors that bounce back the water view. This extraordinary condo is located  with one of the year round heated swimming pools with an indoor entrance, an indoor spa and a coed sauna as well as ping pong and racquetball courts. For a handy happy hour with delicious pupus or a great Polynesian themed meal, Trader Vics is just a few yards from the building entrance.
Watergate is an urban oasis in the heart of the Bay Area. Its central location, free shuttle to BART, well established casual carpool to SF and dedicated freeway entrance to Bay Bridge approach makes for an easy commute to SF or anywhere in the East Bay.  
Rent includes parking, water, hot water, garbage and 82 channels of cable TV. AVAILABLE APPROX. MARCH 19+/- for $2,395 on a 1 year lease. Security deposit $2,695. Application fee $30 per person. There is also a $30 per person move-in fee ($25 of which is refundable). NO PETS, NO SMOKING please. 
For more information or to view,  (BRE# 00692528 at the Realty World - Waterfront Sales and Leasing Office in the heart of the Watergate Complex. 
Realty World Waterfront (DRE #01943875 :: 10 Commodore Drive, Emeryville :: Office Ph.

:: Office open 10-5 M-F, 11-4 Sat-Sun.

listings.description:
Beautifully renovated, sunny, 2 bedroom, 2 bath, single-family home with 3 bonus rooms. 
Available April 1, 2016

See photos at http://www.2419curtis.shutterfly.com 

Kitchen with granite counters, dishwasher, stainless steel cooking range and refrigerator. 
Luxurious Radiant heating and hardwood floors is great for people with allergies and pulmonary problems

Living room with built-in bookshelves and fireplace 
Huge sunny backyard and peaceful garden with lawn, rosebushes, fruit trees, birds and flowers all year round. 6 foot tall, 3 tier, Mediterranean water fountain to soothe you as you enjoy the garden.

Energy-efficient new windows and insulated ceiling and walls 
Large bonus rooms in the basement with plenty of light - great for office, guest room, media room, playroom, etc. 
Cable and phone hookups in every room 
Washer and dryer, one car garage, and one off street parking space in driveway 

Close to elementary schools - Black Pine Circle, Berkeley Montessori, Ecole Bilangue and Rosa Parks Elementary.

One half block from the AC Transit Busline, 2 blocks to various San Pablo bus lines 
About 5 minutes by car or bike to: North Berkeley BART, New Berkeley Bowl, Interstate 80, UC Berkeley, Aquatic Park (great for kids!) or the Berkeley Marina 

Less than 2 minute walk to Long Branch, Paisan and CafeTrieste (live music several nights each week), in the heart of Berkeley's new Bohemia. 

Rent is $4200 per month. Text

to setup an appointment to see the house. 

Non-smokers only. Pet's negotiable. Tenant pays garden care, garbage and utilities. One year lease.

listings.description:
SHOWINGS FOR THIS HOME ARE BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.
LIMITED APPOINTMENT TIMES ARE AVAILABLE.

Please call or text

to request an appointment.

COMMUNITY:
www.edenshoreshoa.org

There is no community like this in all of San Francisco / Bay Area! 
- Convenient access to freeway 880 and 92 Bridge (San Mateo Bridge), Dumbarton Bridge, BART and bus lines
- Community amenities includes an amazing pool, basketball and tennis courts, three playgrounds, clubhouse, open running trails, and soccer field. 
- Bus (AC Transit) from and to San Francisco from community
- Free community events for residents
- Home has a wonderful layout and aesthetics

This luxury home is located in the desirable Eden Shores community of Hayward/Union City. The distinctive floor plan has 5 bedrooms (1 bedroom downstairs), 4.5 bath rooms, 2-car garage, soaring ceiling entry, 9 feet ceilings, formal dining and living room, spacious family room with gas fireplace, and bonus room that can be an office or a study. The large kitchen has custom European cabinets, gas cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, and breakfast bar. The master suite includes a luxurious private bath with two walk-in closets, double sinks & vanities, and separate stall shower. Other amenities include recessed lighting, window coverings, dual-pane windows, central heating, inside laundry room (with washer and dryer), and much more! Private rear yard with room for an organic garden. Walking distance to park, community clubhouse that can be used for parties, basketball courts, tennis courts, swimming pool, playgrounds, running trails, and soccer fields. 

UPPER FLOOR: One master bedroom en-suite bathroom retreat (dual sink vanity and tub, separate shower) with two walk-in closets; laundry room with washer, dryer, and cabinetry; three large-sized bedrooms (one room with a walk in closet and its own full bathroom!); one full bathroom. 

LOWER FLOOR: Bright, spacious & open layout with hardwood floors. One bedroom; one full bathroom with shower/bath; kitchen with appliances and European cabinetry; formal dining and formal living room; family room with gas fireplace; breakfast bar kitchen; an office or study room, and professionally landscaped back yard. 

TWO CAR GARAGE.

LARGE BACKYARD with patio area, professionally landscaped. 

QUALIFICATIONS:
- Good credit report
- Good rental record
- NO smoking or drugs
- 12-month lease required
- 1 month security deposit
- No pets.
- Must submit application, rental references, and paycheck stubs

Close commuting distance to San Francisco, Berkeley, Foster City, San Mateo, Fremont, San Jose, Pleasanton, Dublin, Redwood City, Burlingame, Newark, Oakland -- close to Costco, Walmart, Target, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Ranch 99, Luckies groceries and amenities, theater and cinema, shopping center, restaurants & bars and night life.

Property & Unit Description

Ellsworth Apartments
2312 Ellsworth Street
Berkeley CA 94704 

The Ellsworth Building has approximately 20 apartments and is located just ½ blocks from the UC Berkley Campus. The building consists of 2 separate complexes both of which have studios, 1 & 2 bedroom apartments. Although the apartment buildings are super close to the UC Berkeley campus, cafes, bookstores, parking garages and the Edward Dome Stadium, the apartment building is quiet and peaceful nestled far away from the street towards the back of the property. Tenants experience a great deal of privacy living in "The Ellsworth Building" although they are minutes to the University.

Currently we have a lovely studio apartment as close to UC Berkley as you can get. If you want convenience and the ability to walk to class within 5 minutes, this is the apartment for you!

Neighborhood Information

Neighborhood

The Ellsworth building is located just ½ block to the UC Berkeley Campus and 2 blocks to downtown Berkeley, BART and Telegraph Avenue which is famous for its wide selection of eclectic retail stores, street vendors, parking garages and book stores. In the opposite direction is Shattuck Avenue, bursting with a huge variety of restaurants, juice bars, and ice cream shops. Around the corner is Café Espresso Experience, a great place for a cup of coffee and a delicious pastry. Everything is within reach from The Ellsworth Apartments.

Ellsworth is perfect for those who want to live where the action is. Directly across the street many students, visitors and the San Francisco Bay Area community are entertained by Cal Performances located in the well know "Zellarbach Auditorium". Cal Performances is a vital cultural resource of the Berkley Community and everyone is invited to discover and engage with the many performances, educationally seminars, and free events throughout the year. 

You will also enjoy UC Berkeley's RSF which houses an Olympic-sized swimming pool, indoor basketball courts, weight rooms, squash courts, and sports fields such as CAL Tennis, Track and field.

Property Features
THIS STUDIO FEATURES:

Basement Unit W/ Exterior Entry
(Not much light if that's what you need)
Carpet Throughout
Kitchenette Only
Only 1/2 Block from UC &Telegraph Ave.
Super Close To RSF
WASHER/DRYR IN THE BUILDING!
Water and Garbage are Included
Professionally Property Managed

This 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment is located on the second floor of a charming 4-unit building built in the 20s. It features high ceilings and hardwood floors throughout. The living room is very large and the bedrooms are spacious. The apartment also has a laundry room with a front-load washer-dryer.

Located in one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Berkeley, the apartment is just 3 blocks from the UC campus. The popular shops and restaurants of the gourmet ghetto are also very close. 1 covered parking space is included. Garbage paid by landlord. No smoking. No pets. Rent based on 2 adults. Add $200 for 3 adults (3-adult maximum occupnacy). Available June 1.

listings.description:
Located on the second floor of an attractive 4-unit building in UC Berkeley's popular "southside" neighborhood, this sunny apartment has 4 bedrooms (two are very large), 2 full bathrooms, and a large living area. Two of the bedrooms and 1 bathroom were part of a recently completed addition. The kitchen was partly remodeled, and the apartment has refinished hardwood floors throughout. The apartment features 1920s-style details, and is in very good condition. It has its own private entryway from the street. There is a washer and dryer inside the apartment, as well as an in-demand water heater (tank-less, energy-efficient). The UCB campus is just a few blocks away. Maximum 6 adults. No smoking. No pets. Garbage paid by landlord. Off-street parking may be available for additional rent. Available June 1.

Square footage is approximate.

Pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/garyluria/ choose Album APT 7, you can also see the house

If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with original Victorian (recently refinished) hardwood floors, high ceiling and view . . . 


When you think about it, there is very little competition for Point Richmond's sensation and the deep relaxation that it gives you. My wife and I have been going there from 2002, just to recharge our spirits. A special, different place on the bay.

Located two blocks from Charming downtown Pt Richmond, quiet upscale residential, A short walk to restaurants, shopping, post office, Starbucks etc. For more information about Point Richmond, see http://www.pointrichmond.com/ 

- Please watch a short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY


Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

Applicants must be non-smokers and have no criminal record.

The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (Approx. 500 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.

The area is considered an upscale quite residential neighborhood. To view pictures: Please log on to You can view a short video at : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbpoM9aIkfs 

Directions from Berkeley: Take Richmond Parkway exit; veer to the right; make left to Castro St; another left at the second light still on Castro street; drive straight w/Castro up the hill for about 50 yards or so and turn left to W Richmond Ave. for about 50 yards or so and park at Martina St.

or e-mail back.

listings.title: Great Remodeled Apt. in top location; few blocks to UCB

listings.description:
This renovated apartment is located in an attractive 4-unit building. It is spacious, bright, and has plenty of windows. It has a living room, a dining area, 3 bedrooms, and two full bathrooms. One of the bedrooms and one of the bathrooms were added to the apartment as part of a recent addition. The bedrooms are good-sized, but one is especially large. Refinished hardwood floors are throughout, and there is a washer/dryer inside the apartment. It is ideally located, close to both downtown and the UC Berkeley campus. Both are just a short walk away. Off-street parking may also be available. No smoking. No pets. 4-adult maximum. Available June 1st.

Square footage is approximate.

listings.title: Available 6/1 - Wonderful North Berkeley Apartment Near CAL - Open Sun

listings.description:
Gorgeous quiet central Berkeley one-bedroom apartment in nice neighborhood. Wall to wall rug in living room and bedroom, living room is 12' by 13', bedroom 10' by 10' not including a walk in closet. Living room has doors if you want to use it as a bedroom. Eat-in kitchen has many wood cabinets, 9'x13'. Kitchen windows face to lovely front garden with many flowers, the perfect place to enjoy morning sun. Large bathroom has tile floor, 8'x12'. There is a small hallway perfect for storage. The apartment is bright and sunny with a lot of windows.

Lovely front garden with rosebushes, lemon tree and other pretty flowers.

This is a great location--stroll to BART, 10 minutes by bike to UC, short block to shops, zip onto freeway. Owners pay garbage. No smoking no pets please. Available March 1.

2926 #A Stanton St at Ashby St.

Email or call Jingjing at

Varsity Berkeley
2024 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CA, 94704

Want more info on this unit? See the link (below):
http://apartments.greystar.com/453w3h

Call Now:




Thoughtfully designed and just steps from BART & Berkeley campus.
The Varsity Berkeley provides an unparalleled experience to the University of California, Berkeley. This is where iconic design and unmatched luxury collide to offer well-appointed bedroom suites within a variety of floor plans crafted to match your lifestyle. 

Features
- •	Keyless Access 
- •	Plank Wood Flooring 
- • Huge Windows with Amazing Views 
- •	Stainless Steel Appliance (AEK) 
- •	WiFi

- • Spacious Bathrooms

- •	Central Heat and Air 
- •	Furnished Homes Available 
- • Select Homes Includes Furniture 
- •	Custom Lighting 
- •	Additional Storage 

Community Amenities
- Modern Conveniences Such as Electric Car Charging Stations, Ample Bicycle Parking and AC Transit Passes 
- Private & Group Study Rooms 
- Additional Storage Available On-Site 
- Resident Courtyard with Fire Pit and Fountain 
- Resident Lounge with Wifi and Computer Docking Stations 
- Controlled Access Building 
- Rooftop Terrace with Sunning Deck and Fire Pit 
- Breathtaking Views of the Bay 
- Trash & Recycling Chutes 
Driving Directions
Get on I-80 E from 10th St, Folsom St and Stillman St 13 min (2.2 mi) Continue on I-80 E to Alameda County. Take the MacArthur Blvd exit from I-580 E 8 min (7.4 mi) Take M.L.K. Jr Way to Durant Ave in Berkeley 12 min (3.3 mi) Merge onto W MacArthur Blvd 0.4 mi Turn left onto M.L.K. Jr Way 1.4 mi M.L.K. Jr Way turns slightly right and becomes Adeline St 0.3 mi Slight left onto M.L.K. Jr Way 1.0 mi Turn right onto Channing Way Destination will be on the right across from Toyota 

Office Hours
M-F 9am-6pm 

Pet Policy
Breed Restirctions Apply -- Two Pets Per Household (max) $500 deposit plus $50/mo pet rent

listings.title: Available 6/1 - Lovely North Berkeley Charmer - Walk to Bart! Open Sun

listings.description:
- High speed Internet, landline telephone, Xfinity TV cable connect (with HBO, Showtime, On Demand, etc..), water, utilities all included. 
- Brand new refrigerator, washer/dryer, dishwasher. 
- Fireplace.
- Central heating.
- Partially furnished 
- Rustic/Modern feel.
- Large private deck with deck chairs, table.
- Refreshing cool when too hot outside; Very warm and cozy when cold. 
- 24/7 Parking right in front of the property. 
- Unique location by Tilden park.

750 sq ft.

This beautiful, charming Berkeley hills apartment is the ideal location for someone who seeks the peace and relaxation of a beautiful, natural setting. 

5 minutes away from grocery stores, cafes, restaurants, shopping, etc. on Solano Ave, living here, you will enjoy a large, sunny deck displaying dramatic views of Tilden park. Very friendly neighborhood, nestled in a green and lush cul de sac of 4 houses.

Tilden park is your backyard: picnics on the weekends, hikes, swimming, sports, BBQs, etc. . . . 
Ample parking for friends, family, guests, etc. While quiet, the neighborhood is also party friendly.

Public transportation: Bus: #67; BART: North Berkeley. 
Estimate 20-25 min to Downtown Oakland, 7-10 min to UC Berkeley/Downtown Berkeley, 40min to downtown SF (of course, depending on traffic).

A single tenant (UC Berkeley grad student/professor for example) is preferred.

Available now.

listings.description: Gorgeous fully furnished Mediterranean house, available to quiet or academic people from March 9 to June 7, 2016. Two bedrooms, study, living room w/ cathedral ceiling, dining room, kitchen, laundry. Next to bus line that runs to U.C. campus or central Berkeley BART; also free driveway parking. Expansive view of Golden Gate and San Francisco Bay, magnificent sunsets from living room and deck. $3200/month including all utilities, grand piano, organ, WiFi & gardner. Any nationality welcome. $6400 returnable deposit required because of elegant furnishings. Well-behaved cat welcome.

listings.description:
We are renting our newly remodeled 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment in Berkeley (California street x Carleton). The unit has 
- brand new lamented floor throughout.
- brand new dual pane window in bedrooms and kitchen. 
- new kitchen sink / granite counter top and fridge. 
- new bathroom tub, sink and toilet.
- two large storage closets and each bedroom has its own build-in closet.
- on-site washer and drier.
- one on-site parking space.
- access to the garden at the back of the building.

The apartment is just about a 5 minute bike ride or 15 minute walk from the Ashby Bart station. We are also about 20 minutes walk from the UC Berkeley campus and 10 minute walk to Berkeley Bowl.

Move-in cost: first and last month rent plus $1500 refundable security deposit. One year lease.

No smoking inside the house and no pets.

listings.description:
Fine Arts Apartment for rent from 23. Mai to 8. August. (Option to extend)

We are 4 international students looking to sublet our appartment in Berkeley for the summer (w/ option to extend after our contract expires). The appartment have 2 big bedrooms, with 2 beds and 1 built-in closet in each (which makes room for a total of 4 people). It also has a private kitchen, livingroom and bathroom (w/ shower and bath tub). You will have access to a common laundry room (w/ drying machenes) and a rooftop (perfect for those warm summer afternoons!). 

*We own some of the furniture (except a dinner table w/ 4 chairs which comes with the appartment). This includes a sofa, living room table, 4 beds, 4 chairs, kitchen equipment and 2 dressers (all from IKEA). We will offer to sell these to you for a reasonable price. Even better, we also have 3 bikes that you can choose to buy. We really recommend having bicycles in Berkeley, as it makes it really easy to go to Uni (and give you some more minutes to snooze in the morning..) and the nearby supermarkets (Berkeley Bowl is only 4 minutes bicycles ride away!). Best of all, you can park them in the parking garage, and we'll throw in 2 locks. 

Video of the apartment: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S9ZchX03UWI

If you want to move straight into a fully furnished appartment for easy living in Berkeley, this is definately your place!

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have. Please contact us in either telephone or email.

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

Contact us



www.livehigby.com

Beautifully renovated, sunny, 2 bedroom, 2 bath, single-family home with 3 bonus rooms. Available April 1, 2016

See photos at http://www.2419curtis.shutterfly.com 

Kitchen with granite counters, dishwasher, stainless steel cooking range and refrigerator. 
Luxurious Radiant heating and hardwood floors is great for people with allergies and pulmonary problems 
Charming bathroom with skylight, granite counters, and more 
Living room with built-in bookshelves and fireplace 
Huge sunny backyard and peaceful garden with lawn, rosebushes, fruit trees, birds and flowers all year round. 6 foot tall, 3 tier, Mediterranean water fountain to soothe you as you enjoy the garden.

Energy-efficient new windows and insulated ceiling and walls 
Large bonus rooms in the basement with plenty of light - great for office, guest room, media room, playroom, etc. 
Cable and phone hookups in every room 
Washer and dryer, one car garage, and one off street parking space in driveway 

Close to elementary schools - Black Pine Circle, Berkeley Montessori, Ecole Bilangue and Rosa Parks Elementary.

One half block from the AC Transit Busline, 2 blocks to various San Pablo bus lines 
About 5 minutes by car or bike to: North Berkeley BART, New Berkeley Bowl, Interstate 80, UC Berkeley, Aquatic Park (great for kids!) or the Berkeley Marina 

Less than 2 minute walk to Long Branch, Paisan and CafeTrieste (live music several nights each week), in the heart of Berkeley's new Bohemia. 

Rent is $4200 per month. Text

to setup an appointment to see the house. 

Non-smokers only. Pet's negotiable. Tenant pays garden care, garbage and utilities. One year lease.

listings.description: This is a 4 bedroom/2 bath flat that was renovated very recently and it is within a very short walking distance from the south side of the UC campus. It has a very high ceiling with storage lofts in all bedrooms, a modern kitchen with dishwasher and garbage disposal. In addition, it has a central heating system, instant hot water heater system, washer/dryer, and parking. This place will be available by August 1, 2016.
listings.title: Loft Style 4+ BR - Walk to UC - South Side

listings.description:
Beautiful 2 bedroom apartment on the 1st floor in a 4-plex. Hardwood floors, remodeled kitchen with gas stove, granite counters, dishwasher, and garbage disposal. Single bathroom. Includes 1 off-street parking place. 

Owner pays garbage and sewer. Cat OK. Coin-operated laundry. 

Fabulous northside location. Walk to UCB, Walnut Square (Chez Panisse). Short drive to Tilden Park and Solano Ave. shops and restaurants. 

Deposit is $4200.
listings.title: Beautiful 2 bedroom close to UCB - 1503 Oxford #1

listings.description:
Video tour:
https://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxg

AVAILABLE: April 1 Thru October 31 (could be later) - I'm taking off for a 6 month hike and could live in my camper for a couple months when I get back if you needed to go through December.

FINANCIAL STUFF:
Monthly: 2,495
Deposit: 2,495
Pets: Will accept a small dog, if you watch my small dog (or I'll have my parents watch my dog)
Utilities: All included

SELLING POINTS:
*Furnished
*Newly Renovated, hard wood built in cabinetry in kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and new flooring and painted house and rooms.
*Hot tub access
*Victorian features
*High ceilings
*Bay windows
*Large windows (natural light)
*You can see mt. tam from the dining room.
*Walk 2 BART
*Near major bus lines (51,72, SF commuter)
*Near strawberry creek park (w/café, yoga studio, etc).
*Washing maching (dishes)
*Coin Op washer/dryer in yard (cloths)
*Access to a small shared yard that has a hot-tub.

NEIGHBORHOOD:
Walking to BART, transit, park.
Places to eat (over 10 resturaunts) including Your place Thai and Land Splitters.
Near pubs (acme, albatross. . . and not too far from Missouri lounge)
Places to buy food (several small grocery stores)
Post office, cheese store, german food, chineese food, Pakistani food, Indian, thai, Italian, café. . .. . ... more
Neighbors are a mix of new money and working class families.
There is a youth center that get graffiti on the building at times.
There are million dollar homes.
There are shitty looking apartment buildings.
There are tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball net.
Bank, hardware store.
Basically, the only thing I think you can not buy in the neighborhood is sheets and pillows (use amazon). . . Neighborhood has what you need.

DESCRIPTION OF THE UNIT
As you enter it, you enter into a large Living Room with a gas fireplace with built in hardwood shelving, couches, and a hang out area. To the right is a large bedroom with a bay window and tall ceilings and a closet as well as a built in wood closet. Off the living room is an entrance to the kitchen (which is not huge in size, but has built in cabinetry that is douglas fir, granite countertops, and newly renovated. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cabinets, stove, fridge, microwave etc. . . Off of the kitchen is the Bathroom. This place is in a tri-plex where a neighbor shares the bottom floor and the top floor is another neighbor. Just outside through the backdoor off of the kitchen is a small side-yard that has a Hot-Tub as well as a laundry area and places to put things under the house or stash your bike.

Video tour
https://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxg

Can be furnished or unfurnished.

Email me for more info or if you have any questions or would like to arrange a time to see it.
listings.title: April Thru October - Video Tour - Built in wood cabinetry

listings.title: 1 bedroom 1 bathroom fully furnished. NO EXTRA FEEs

listings.description:
Telegraph Commons Student Housing is located right in the heart of Berkeley. We are just 2 blocks away from Cal Campus, dining, entertainment, and so much more.

Telegraph Commons offers some very spacious student dorm layouts that come fully furnished with all your needs such as, a bed, desk, set of drawers, locker closet and every room comes with its very own mini fridge. Each floor offers a fully equipped kitchen, laundry room, shared and private bathroom. We currently have double rooms available for Spring Semester 2016, but they are going fast!

If this sounds like something you would be interested in, do not hesitate to contact our community and schedule a tour! You can reach us directly by phone or by email. Also if you would like to view more community features and pictures, as well as apply online you can visit www.telegraphcommons.com.
listings.title: Privately owned UCB student housing! Call now one month free!!

listings.title: 1 bedroom+1 bathroom fully furnished apartment

listings.description:
With sweeping views of the Bay and Golden Gate Bridges, the San Francisco Skyline & the Oakland Skyline...Pacific Park Plaza has something for everyone and is a commuter's dream! It is located about 1 mile from the Bay Bridge and close to the Eastshore Freeways, as well as Berkeley and Downtown Oakland and Downtown San Francisco. This has a better commute to downtown SF than if you lived in many parts of SF!

ACCESS: Local - Emery Go Round public bus service is free! http://www.emerygoround.com/maps---schedules.html It takes you to many places including the Ashby Bart Station. 1/2 mile walk to Amtrak Station.

To SF - the AC Transit J Line to SF stops right in front of the building. Return via the AC Transit Z Line. Or take Ashby Bart via Emery Go Round. (15min)

To Oakland - easy commute via AC transit or Bart, both available right downstairs from the apartment.


Gorgeous 1 bedroom 1 bathroom @ Pacific Park Plaza with floor to ceiling surround window views
Newly remodeled with hardwood flooring, dual-tone paint, new cabinets, stainless steel sinks, granite countertops/shower, whirlpool appliances (oven, microwave, fridge and dishwasher en-suite) 
Large, spacious walk-in closet and an additional three door mirrored, sliding closet with California cabinets for superior organization. This is the only newly renovated and best unit in the building! Great deal for move-in and rent will NEVER increase. 

24 hour access to shared pool, Jacuzzi, sauna, fitness center, tennis, basketball court and more
24 hour secured entry with the ability to safely receive packages on your behalf
Includes 1 dedicated sheltered parking space with remote key access

Right across the street from the Emeryville Public Market
Free shuttle to BART, walk to Trader Joe's, Berkeley Bowl, Bay Street and more!
AC Transit Bus literally downstairs from the building that takes you directly to SF within 15min
Free Cable TV Included and Discount DSL Available
Available March 1st for Move-in
Email or text to schedule a showing at any time

Now renting newly renovated 1, 2 and 3 bedroom Alameda, CA apartments, featuring modern design and luxury finishes throughout, Panomar is the premier destination for apartments in the Bay Area. listings.description: This apartment is a wonderful, large space in a 1906 house. It has a private side entrance with a tall spiral staircase leading to a deck with views of the east bay hills. It has a claw foot tub with shower and a private duel flush toilet and sink. The kitchen has counter height fridge and freezer and our counters are made of recycled bowling alley. There is a small Wedgewood stove with oven. The main floor of the house has some young (30+) professionals living downstairs. This artistic apartment comes furnished and would be perfect for quiet grad student. Close to West Berkeley restaurants and bus lines direct to UC Berkeley. Easy access to the freeway. Backyard for gardening. No pets. $1800 - includes utilities. Available now.

listings.description:
Available March 10 for non smokers only. A bright and sunny end unit , Includes private deck with view! . A large private with panoramic view. features:
- Bed room with a queen size bed, with wi-fi and cable TV, built in desk and a headboard with drawers and shelves. 
- Bathroom wish a shower stall
- Kitchen with a full size fridge. stove, oven, micro wave and toaster, cap board, flat ware, pots and pan, dishes, glasses, cookware
- Large closet with an additional closet for storage a few yards from the entrance door
- Private deck with a view
- Washer/Dryer on site
- A large 'community' back yard/deck with a little garden which gets afternoon sun; a good place for sun-bathing and barbecuing. On-site laundry facility and ample street parking are available. most utilities included. Dogs/Cats are OK if they are quite. Street parking always available for you and your guests.

Pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/garyluria/ choose Album APT 7, you can also see the house

If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with original Victorian (recently refinished) hardwood floors, high ceiling and view . . . 


When you think about it, there is very little competition for Point Richmond's sensation and the deep relaxation that it gives you. My wife and I have been going there from 2002, just to recharge our spirits. A special, different place on the bay.

Located two blocks from Charming downtown Pt Richmond, quiet upscale residential, A short walk to restaurants, shopping, post office, Starbucks etc. For more information about Point Richmond, see http://www.pointrichmond.com/ 

- Please watch a short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY


Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

Applicants must be non-smokers and have no criminal record.

The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (Approx. 500 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.

The area is considered an upscale quite residential neighborhood. To view pictures: Please log on to You can view a short video at : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbpoM9aIkfs 

Directions from Berkeley: Take Richmond Parkway exit; veer to the right; make left to Castro St; another left at the second light still on Castro street; drive straight w/Castro up the hill for about 50 yards or so and turn left to W Richmond Ave. for about 50 yards or so and park at Martina St. 

Please call Gary at

or e-mail back.

listings.title: Higby Apartments- Brand New Apartments with Gorgeous views of the Bay

listings.description:
This could be your new home! 

California Apartments is a restored 90-year-old building with many long-term residents. The apartments in this vintage building have hardwood floors, tall ceilings, gas stoves and great bathtubs. There is on-site laundry and a community garden. We value our home and we are looking for someone who is friendly and quiet and wants to be a part of our community. 

This unit is available now. Are you our next neighbor?

OPEN HOUSE
Sunday, Feb 28, 10-11am
Call or text me (Dorrit, the on-site manager) if you have any questions.

APARTMENT DESCRIPTION 
*1920s stucco building 
* Hardwood floors 
* Large, walk-in closets (you won't believe the closet space!)
* Eat-in kitchen with gas stove
* Gas oven and gas heat
* 9 foot ceilings 
* Full bathroom with bathtub/shower 
* Double-paned windows
* Owner pays water, hot water, garbage 
* Tenant pays gas, electric & phone 
* One-year lease minimum

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION
* Four blocks to the North Berkeley BART Station 
* Six blocks to downtown Berkeley and the Berkeley BART
* Five blocks to Trader Joe's
* Two blocks to Ohlone Park and close to the Ohlone Bike Path
* Walking distance to the Berkeley Rep, Freight & Salvage, movie theaters and restaurants
* On a major bus line (the 51
* Easy access to 4th Street, the freeway, Gourmet Ghetto, and much, much more!

BUILDING AMENITIES 
* Friendly, on-site management 
* Controlled-access entry and intercom system 
* Coin-operated laundry room on premises 
* Parking space available in secured lot for an extra $95 per month 
* Secure bicycle parking (free!) 
* Community Garden! 

APPLICATION PROCESS 
* completed and signed application form 
* proof of income equaling 2 times the monthly rent (check stubs) 
* copy of recent bank statement 
* non-refundable fee of $20 for a credit check 

MOVE-IN COSTS
* First month's rent 
* $2000 deposit 

OTHER INFO
* No pets 
* No smoking
* No handicapped access (Sorry, old building! There is an elevator once you are inside, but there are a few steps at the entrance of the building.) 
* Photos are of similar apartment

listings.title: Welcome to Higby Apartments where there is no place like home!

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

Contact us

listings.description:
Open house Saturday & Sunday (2/27 - 2/28/16: 9:00-11:30 A.M.

Your new lovely 2 story flat in this accessory unit is located midway up on the El Cerrito Hills with gorgeous views of the Golden Gate Bridge, S.F., Mt. Tam, Bay Bridge, and all the waters in between. This is where you sip wine, meditate, watch the sunsets and write your blogs. Your home has 2 major decks on two levels with 3 BR (one ensuite) and 2 BA, floor to ceiling windows and patio door entrance stepping onto two very spacious decks overlooking the views and the garden. The bedrooms measure: 12' x 12', 13.5' x 10.5' and 13.5' by 8.75' in addition to the normal sized wall closets. The open concept kitchen is connected to the living room space for a measurement of approx. 19' L x 11' W. 

The newly renovated flats have hardwood floors throughout, LED lighting, energy efficient refrigerator, dishwasher, dual pane windows, granite kitchen counter & fresh paint. The western bridge & water view and sun exposure. The open and spacious yard is full of trees bearing organic grapefruits and pear fruits from early spring through fall. Laundry on-site. Convenient street parking. Multiple decks & stairs lead to the two entry doors, so not wheelchair accessible.

Looking for: 
- Responsible & Quiet tenant with good rental history 
- Someone who is easy to work with
- Good Credit required
- Non-smoker
- Sorry, no pets

Available March 1st. $3450 monthly rent, $3,300 security deposit. Tenant responsible for prorated gas/electric, water and garbage. One year lease or longer. 

Available to show most days with a couple of hours notice. Please call Eva

to schedule. Call Amy

(sorry, no text) upon arrival for viewing.

About the neighborhood: Leafy streets dotted with neighborhood parks wind their way up the hill, leading to beautiful estates with impeccably manicured gardens and panoramic views of San Francisco Bay and Marin. The property is located in a very accessible neighborhood! Three (3 min drive/8 min bike/15 min walk to El Cerrito Plaza BART (10 minutes to downtown Berkeley, 25 to San Francisco) and the Fairmount Mall, packed with all the box stores and a great Italian restaurant and 5 blocks from a cultural selection of restaurants, cafes, and Natural Grocer on San Pablo Ave., a 5 min drive to the very quaint Kensington Circle where you'd find charming pub with British fare, beer & live music, along with other shops in the European like village setting. 5 Minutes to Freeway access 

About El Cerrito: 
El Cerrito hosts a local farmer's market twice a week at the El Cerrito Plaza, which is also home to major chains including Bed Bath & Beyond and Barnes & Noble. Remnants of "old El Cerrito" can still be found on San Pablo Avenue where merchants include a funky store specializing in acoustic and folk music and Giovanni's Italian Grocery.

El Cerrito is strategically located along Interstate 80 and is less than 30 miles from San Francisco and Oakland International airports. Its extensive transportation system includes two BART stations, direct bus lines to Berkeley, downtown San Francisco and Oakland, and 5 minutes to freeway access.
listings.title: 3BR/2BA: Pano Views & Double Decks!

listings.description:
Includes a private deck with view! This one is good especially for someone who need storage in the unit, and likes to spend time in the kitchen - it has a large eat-in kitchen. A large deck with panoramic view. The Living room has large 4 windows and view.



Available for rent March 10 for nonsmokers only.



If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with original Victorian (recently refinished) hardwood floors, high ceiling and view . . . 


When you think about it, there is very little competition for Point Richmond's sensation and the deep relaxation that it gives you. My wife and I have been going there from 2002, just to recharge our spirits. A special, different place on the bay.




Located two blocks from Charming downtown Pt Richmond, quiet upscale residential, A short walk to restaurants, shopping, post office, Starbucks etc. For more information about Point Richmond, see http://www.pointrichmond.com/ 

- Please watch a short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY


Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

Applicants must be non-smokers and have no criminal record.









A bright and sunny end unit with view of Point Richmond. Features eat-in kitchen with lots (about 13 of cupboards, gas oven/stove & full-size refrigerator. Gas cooking, cold and hot water, and garbage are included. Features a large living room with three large windows, large kitchen, and a bedroom with build in drawers and shelves. Two large closets, and a large 3 part linen closet in the bathroom. The airflow is very effectively controlled by the living room window ?C to which degree they are opened.





A large 'community' back yard/deck with a little garden which gets afternoon sun; a good place for sun-bathing and barbecuing. On-site laundry facility and ample street parking are available. most utilities included. Dogs/Cats are OK if they are quite. Street parking always available for you and your guests.





The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (Approx. 500 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.







The area is considered an upscale quite residential neighborhood. To view pictures: Please log on to http://www.flickr.com/photos/garyluria/ look for Click on 'group list' at the top part of the page and then select group 405-6 and you should be able to view the pics. You can also view the house. You can also view a short video at : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbpoM9aIkfs 

.







Directions from Berkeley: Take Richmond Parkway exit; veer to the right; make left to Castro St; another left at the second light still on Castro street; drive straight w/Castro up the hill for about 50 yards or so and turn left to W Richmond Ave. for about 50 yards or so and park at Martina St.

or e-mail back.

Monthly: 2,495

SELLING POINTS:
*Furnished
*Newly Renovated, hard wood built in cabinetry in kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and new flooring and painted house and rooms.
*Hot tub access
*Victorian features
*High ceilings

NEIGHBORHOOD:
Walking to BART, transit, park.
Places to eat (over 10 resturaunts) including Your place Thai and Land Splitters.
Near pubs (acme, albatross. . . and not too far from Missouri lounge)
Places to buy food (several small grocery stores)
Post office, cheese store, german food, chineese food, Pakistani food, Indian, thai, Italian, café. . .. . ... more
Neighbors are a mix of new money and working class families.
There is a youth center that get graffiti on the building at times.
There are million dollar homes.
There are shitty looking apartment buildings.
There are tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball net.
Bank, hardware store.
Basically, the only thing I think you can not buy in the neighborhood is sheets and pillows (use amazon). . . Neighborhood has what you need.

DESCRIPTION OF THE UNIT
As you enter it, you enter into a large Living Room with a gas fireplace with built in hardwood shelving, couches, and a hang out area. To the right is a large bedroom with a bay window and tall ceilings and a closet as well as a built in wood closet. Off the living room is an entrance to the kitchen (which is not huge in size, but has built in cabinetry that is douglas fir, granite countertops, and newly renovated. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cabinets, stove, fridge, microwave etc. . . Off of the kitchen is the Bathroom. This place is in a tri-plex where a neighbor shares the bottom floor and the top floor is another neighbor. Just outside through the backdoor off of the kitchen is a small side-yard that has a Hot-Tub as well as a laundry area and places to put things under the house or stash your bike.

Email me for more info or if you have any questions or would like to arrange a time to see it.

listings.description:
Nature is whispering in your ears. A rare woodland retreat! Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!

Dog ok up to 25lbs. Pet insurance required. Owner will approve breed, not agent. References needed (from pet hospital too).

Brief Description:
Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993. Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993, this comfortable two-story in-law unit is one bedroom, one bath with private entrance wonderful garden area and a view looking directly to San Francisco. Gardens private tranquil forested setting.

While this house offers the one-of-a-kind charm of an authentic Mediterranean style Montclair home -- complete with authentic architectural details -- modern updates throughout balance ease of living for today's lifestyle. The layout and functionality are perfect: tall vaulted entry, Spanish tile floors and carpeting, a large living room with high ceiling and corner room windows, space-saver, modern kitchen, provide excellent flow throughout the living areas across two levels. Sunny second floor bedroom and large bath on the the main level. 
The upstairs bedroom with private deck and bay view is accessible through a spiral staircase!

Old style plaster interior walls give this home a cozy woodland feel. There is a sophisticated warmth about this in-law apartment.

Owner pays utilities, trash and gardening. Application fee is $30 per adult (18+). Credit score must be 700 plus.

Neighborhood and Vicinity:
Yes, location is everything. The East Bay Regional Parks Lake Temescal open space area is within walking distance. The Hills Swim and Tennis Club are moments away on Thornhill Drive. Shopping and dining in Montclair Village is just down Mountain Blvd. You won't want to miss nearby Montclair Village, only a mile away, with its abundance of restaurants, boutique stores, design galleries, ice cream and coffee shops. There are bakeries, retail shopping, two supermarkets, and a host of other chow providers very nearby as well.

Nearby, the Temescal and Tilden Regional Recreation areas offer hiking and swimming. Enjoy Lake Temescal with its sweet beach, walking paths and fishing spots. We are within minutes of many other amazing hiking, biking, and riding trails and parks.

This home is less than five miles from UC Berkeley. PIXAR, Bayer, Kaiser Hospital, Summitt Hospital and Alta Bates Hospital are all within an easy drive. Downtown Berkeley and Oakland are 10-15 minutes close by. There is excellent transit availability on Broadway Terrace and Mountain Blvd. Commuters will appreciate the easy access to the Rockridge BART station.

This location is also ideal if you'd like to visit the Oakland Rose Garden or the Sculpture Gardens Jack London Square, the University of California, Berkeley, or Silicon Valley. Downtown Oakland has some of the best restaurants in California, not to mention a downtown lake, complete with gondolas and a running path.

For baseball fans, the SF Giants are 25 minutes away by car, BART, or Ferry. The Ferry drops you off at Center Field before the game and picks you up 20 min. after. The Oakland Coliseum, home of the fabulous Oakland Athletics, is 20 min away by car or BART. Street parking is free and ample.

Getting Around:
San Francisco is only 20 minutes away, Muir Woods a quick 45 minute drive, and the wineries of Napa and Sonoma are an hour away. We are 20 minutes from Oakland airport and 35 minutes from SFO. BART, with a station just 1.5 miles away, goes into downtown Oakland and San Francisco, as well as to both airports. The ferry system, a more scenic mode of transportation, goes from Jack London Square to San Francisco, Marin, or Angel Island. From the Ferry Station in SF, you can get a boat to Alcatraz Island, one of the most famous prisons in the world. It makes for a wonderful day trip.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!

Highlights
•	Private woodland retreat in the Montclair hills.
•	Available partly furnished
•	Located on a large tranquil forested lot.
•	Spanish tile and carpet throughout.
•	Large sunny living room with corner garden view windows.
•	One bedroom upstairs via spiral staircase. 1 bath on main level.
•	Kitchen with tile floor, modern cabinetry, solid countertop, gas range top, microwave, refrigerator, stainless sink, modern lighting.
•	Abundance of natural light.
•	Soft tone neutral paint colors.
•	Excellent off-street parking.
•	Utilities paid by owner, gardening and garbage paid by owner
•	Asking rent $2200 monthly

• No pets/animals
• Contact broker/property mgr, Frank Hennefer,

BRE 00852682

listings.description:
https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharing

when we were looking for a place we initially wanted to be on a main street.. 

piedmont, grand, college (both berkeley and oakland), bay st, fourth st, university, you get the idea. . . 

but we couldn't figure out which... 
and we didn't know what that would mean for parking... 
and we weren't sure how close that would put us to highways if we need to leave town :) 

so... 
we wrote down every place we like in the east bay... 
Including. . . 

http://www.4thstreetshop.com/ 
shopping outdoors 
http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/piedmont.shtml 
restaurants & independent movies 
http://www.baystreetemeryville.com/ 
commercial/mall like & mainstream movies 
http://www.shattuckshop.com/ 
decent coffee shops and various ethnic foods 
http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/grand.shtml 
a lake, a farmers market, a theatre, delis, bakeries, and both starbucks for her, petes for me 
http://www.shopparkstreet.com/ 
a little further out in alameda, a longer stretch that used to be trees and is now everything else 
http://www.oaklandchinatownchamber.org/visitor/about_chinatown.html 
smaller, but more authentic then sf chinatown 
http://jacklondonsquare.com/ 
shopping, dining, jazz, waterfront 

and PUT IT ON A MAP... Just like this... 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharing

and then we picked the center of it all... 
ADELINE ST, EMERYVILLE 

And 80, 580, 880, 980, 24, 13, etc are all very very accessible... 

so now we're close to everything we want, 
we can eat, play, sleep, read a book, see a movie, go to the park, go to berkeley bowl, go to university of berkeley, etc. 
we can get on a highway that takes us to SF in 10 minutes, 
we can leave behind the car at the ashby bart if we want to be good to the environment, 
we have a place to park (secured on our lot) 
we have a washer and dryer (secured - no coins) 
we have internet access 
we have utilities 


FAQ 

availability - place just got posted, is available, but we got more responds then we expected, so pardon the generic reply: 

showing the unit - we will look at applications this week, show the unit the week of 01/11. earliest move-in will be 02/01, though 03/01 is preferable.

kids - ok to have kids, there are schools, and a childrens hospital in the area 

supermarkets - plenty in the area... from shop n save, to safeway, to berkeley bowl, to whole foods 

layout - see picture below 

price - there's a 1BR 4 blocks away renting for 2500 - in fact, looking at 3900 Adeline, which is closer to best buy/ikea and highway noise, but further from UC Berkeley, Oakland down to Alameda, and you'll see STUDIOs renting for $1775 (not to mention parking) - look at the pricing in all of emeryville, and you find that it's already priced to rent. the market is hot, but we want a long term tenant so it's priced fairly.

those who travel alot - you can leave your car and disappear whenever you'd like, just give us a notice so we don't worry about you 

check scams - no interest in cashing checks ahead of time and giving you the difference. 

delayed rental - looking to rent asap. not sure we could guarantee the place for anything more than a month delay, and only to the right candidate, with a deposit, and the other general warnings 

out of towners - no problem if you're relocating, and feel free to ask questions... again, if there's a delay in move, please make sure to communicate it early and see the above line 

move in costs - unless you're a terrible person, with terrible credit, and a terrible attitude, first+last month will be sufficient. 

DISHWASHER - YES, UPDATING THE POST TO REFLECT THAT TOO... THANKS FOR REMINDING US. 

anything else that was neglected in the posting - feel free to ask

This unit is under 700 sqft. We had an earlier posting for a similar (slightly smaller) property down the street. That unit was rented out one day after posting and went for over asking, 6 months paid in advance. This location and price point are not going to be matched. We are looking for good long term tenants. Please allow 48 hours for responses.

listings.description:
Located on the 28th floor, this special unit is one of the few penthouses (with floor to ceiling windows) and has the most desirable western facing view of the Golden Gate Bridge and San Francisco Bay. The other units available in this building are smaller, on a lower floor, do not have floor to ceiling windows, or have a view of the hills or of the northbound freeway, not the bay and sunsets.

With sweeping views of the Bay and Golden Gate Bridges, the San Francisco Skyline & the Oakland Skyline...Pacific Park Plaza has something for everyone and is a commuter's dream! It is located about 1 mile from the Bay Bridge and close to the Eastshore Freeways, as well as Berkeley and Downtown Oakland and Downtown San Francisco. This has a better commute to downtown SF than if you lived in many parts of SF!

The building is across the street from the Emery Bay shopping area and Public Market Complex. It is 1/2 a mile walk to Bay Street or the Trader Joe's. It's 1.2 miles from Berkeley Bowl West (Heinz Street). 

UNIT DESCRIPTION: Home features a spacious open floor plan with large floor to ceiling windows, 9 foot high ceilings, and an open galley kitchen. 1 master bedroom (with attached full bathroom) with dining/living room, and separate den/study which can be used as a 2nd bedroom (has a full closet and the best view of the bay from this room). Spacious full kitchen with fridge, microwave, stove, oven and dishwasher. Half bathroom (sink and toilet) in hallway. The unit is fully carpeted, except for the kitchen and entryway. This layout is known as Floorplan "A" with 1144 square feet.

We require a 1 year lease and security deposit. No Pets, No Smoking. Other restrictions from the Condo Association may apply.

ACCESS: Local - Emery Go Round public bus service is free! http://www.emerygoround.com/maps---schedules.html It takes you to many places including the Ashby Bart Station. 1/2 mile walk to Amtrak Station. 

To SF - the AC Transit J Line to SF stops right in front of the building. Return via the AC Transit Z Line. Or take Ashby Bart via Emery Go Round.

PPP Amenities:

- Panoramic and dramatic San Francisco/Oakland Views
- 2 private balconies
- Dishwasher & Disposal
- 1 Reserved parking space in covered garage 
- Overflow Parking in South Garage (outdoor, fenced access, non-reserved)
- Basic Cable TV Service
- Trash Chute on each floor
- Laundry Facility on each floor
- Elevators
- 24 Hr Security Patrol
- Air Conditioning & Heater (tenant pays pg&e)


Recreation Facilities (free to residents):
- 24-Hour Full-Size Gym on-site
- Swimming Pool (heated year-round) 
- Outdoor Hot-Tub (heated year-round)
- Basket Ball Court
- 2 Tennis Courts
- Sauna & Steam Room

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

listings.description:
My roommate is graduating in May and my boyfriend and I are looking for a replacement. The apartment is a two bedroom-one bath on Spruce street (5 min walk to campus, 8 min walk to bart). We are sharing a double in the apartment and looking for someone to take the single bedroom. Utilities (just cable and PG&E) usually comes to about $30 a month. Parking spot available, coin-operated washer and dryer on site, hard wood floors, and is completely furnished. The lease is from May 2016-May 2017. Pets are negotiable.
A little about us: We are both UC Berkeley students in our twenties and very stable (no drama or rent issues). He's studying Chemical Engineering and I'm studying Integrative Biology. We are both really studious and when we have free time we like to watch Netflix, cook awesome meals, explore SF/East bay, and go on runs/to the gym. We tend to be home bodies but the room we share is pretty big so you'll have your space. 
Looking for: Someone who is laid back, respectful, and relatively clean.
Lease renewal is due soon so we are looking for someone who can sign soon. 
If you're interested, we can set up a visit and discuss details further. Thanks!
*There is a queen sized bed in the room right now so it looks smaller than it actually is.

listings.title: 2 Bed 1 Bath- Unit 309

listings.description:
Life on a boat is a very peaceful experience, but you are also centered next to everything here. It is truly the best of both worlds. You have complete access to Oakland, Berkeley, and SF with the serenity of a park-like atmosphere. The Marina has picnic and BBQ areas for you to enjoy year round.

When you are not enjoying the spectacular views of the bay, enjoy touring around Oakland, Berkeley and San Francisco! There is also a kitchenette with a hotplate skillet, toaster oven, refrigerator, microwave, electric water kettle, and hand pumped water. Elegant lighting and curtains give a cozy feel in your home away from home. There is a twin sized bed and functioning toilet. On the back deck there is a small Weber gas grill.

Private bath house and laundry facility with wifi and tv on the premises.

I will respect your privacy, but I am on call if you need anything

Location, Location, Location! 

This place is magical. The views of the Golden Gate Bridge and the skyline of San Francisco at sunset are breathtaking. People come here just to take photos at sunset. Emeryville is the center of the bay. There is an outdoor mall and shopping center within walking distance, and there is also a FREE SHUTTLE that will take you to these places. The mall has everything from the Apple Store to Old Navy and an AMC theater. Guitar Center, Trader Joe's and Bev Mo are just around the corner as well. If you want to get into the city of San Francisco, we are located right across the bay and have what I call a private driveway into the city, as the on ramp to the Bay Bridge is just at the end of the marina.

Public transit is free! The Emery-go-Round is a shuttle that comes every 15 minutes and will take you to the local shops and BART.

The wifi is spotty. It works ok, but I use a range extending antenna and that gives me no problems. Amped wireless is the brand name.

You have complete access to all parts of the boat, however, I do ask that you refrain from operating any valves, rigging, or the motor.

I only ask that you respect the boat and all her inner workings. The toilet is does not accept solid waste, but there is a Private Bath house with large showers and a laundry room with a TV and WiFi. This is a private marina so please respect the guests and residents here by keeping down the noise levels. Also, you will need access keys that I will provide. You will be responsible for lost keys at the rate of $100 per key. Thank you. Happy House Hunting!
listings.title: Awesome rental on a sailboat! Your own private house on the water!

listings.description:
Premier living in Richmond's Hilltop district 

San Marcos Apartments in Richmond, California offers convenience so you can focus on fun. Park your vehicle in the comfort of your own private garage, then head inside and spend an evening cozying up next to the fireplace. Whatever your ideal furniture arrangement might be, we offer numerous floor plans in our one- and two-bedroom apartments that are sure to complement your interior design savvy. Controlled, gated access and night patrol means you sleep soundly, and our on-site maintenance team is available 24/7 for all of those "Uh-oh!" moments. Feeling stressed? Take advantage of our fitness center and sports courts for that calorie burn, or stroll down beautifully manicured pathways with your pooch to get some fresh air (yes, of course, these Richmond apartments are pet friendly).

Our location in Richmond's Hilltop neighborhood puts you near tons of great places to shop and dine. Head to the Vista del Mar Village Shopping Center to pick up a latte at Starbucks, or shop to your heart's content at the Hilltop Mall, home to staples like Macy's and JC Penny as well as a Wal-Mart. Fresh air abounds at nearby Hilltop Lake Park, and we are also minutes away from the Richmond Country Club and Pointe Pinole Regional Shoreline. Need to get out of Richmond? Hop on I-80 for an easy drive to other cities in the Bay Area. If you don't feel like wasting gas, we are also near bus lines and a few miles from the Richmond Transit Station.

Life should be enjoyed, and here at San Marcos Apartments you will have plenty of opportunity to do just that.

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

All utilities included two rooms with private entrance, private bathroom & private yard - $2100-2500
2 couples are allowed.
